page.title: 01SUMMARY
page.content: THE TRAQUAIR AREA LIES IN TWEEDALE, ONE OF THE FOUR DISTRICTS OF THE BORDERS REGION IN SCOTLAND. THE AREA IS ENTIRELY RURAL BUT LIES WITHIN A SHORT DISTANCE OF INNERLEITHEN, A SMALL INDUSTRIAL TOWN. THE WHOLE AREA IS VERY HILLY AND SCENICALLY ATTRACTIVE, RISING FROM APPROXIMATELY 140M BESIDE THE RIVER TWEED TO OVER 470M ABOVE SEA LEVEL. THE HILLSIDES ARE STEEP AND MAINLY NORTH-FACING. OVER HALF OF THE BLOCK IS COVERED WITH CONIFEROUS PLANTATIONS, MAINLY OWNED BY THE FORESTRY COMMISSION, AND THE REST OF THE LAND IS USED FOR AGRICULTURE, MAINLY UPLAND SHEEP PASTURE. TRAQUAIR ITSELF IS VERY SMALL HAMLET, CONSISTING OF A LOOSE CLUSTER OF COTTAGES BUT WITH NO FACILITIES OTHER THAN A TELEPHONE KIOSK AND A LETTER BOX.
